result.execSummary:
The defendant Erick Lee Lomker was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Disorderly Conduct [Modifiers: Penalties for Misdemeanors-Class "B"], a class B misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 947.01(1).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

records.addlTxt: From Monica Parent on behalf of the DE on 2-08-19 stating they will pay @ the end of next wk.  Ret'd call to Monica today & left a v/m stating that pymt is approved to be pd by 4 pm on 2-15-19 & that pymts are expected on or before the 5th of ea mo.  jaf

DE called stating he forgot to make his pymt & would like to pay on Mon.  DE is approved to make his pymt by 4:30 pm on 12-10-18.  jaf
**DE called back requesting to make pymt on 12-17-18 isntead.  DE is approved to make his late Dec pymt by 4:30 pm on 12-17-18, but was advised that the court is not allowing any further deferments as he's had several & his pymts are expected on or before his due date of the 5th.  DE stated he had the money then forgot to make the pymt & now has to wait til he gets pd again.  DE to be turned over to SDC if he misses another pymt.  jaf

From DE for deferment of his Oct pymt & to make a double pymt w/Nov's pymt.  jaf
DEF called regarding request for extension for payment plan, will send fax with letter to Judge Vlack today     rsr
DE called to verify if his pymt was made this mo.  DE was advised that his Sept pymt was pd on 8-31-18 & his next pymt is due 10-05-18.  jaf

per court order, given to payment clerk to reinstate payment plan. gme

From DE in writing.  DE to pay $40/mo comm 4-05-18 (Mar & Apr pymts) then $20/mo comm 5-05-18.  DE will be mailed an updated Order for Pymt.  jaf
Filed by Def. Requesting more time to make a payment. km                                           to Collection Clerk

DE called to state that he forgot about his pymt, just started a new job, & needs an ext.  DE was advised that he will need to make his late pymt or submit a request in writing by 4:30 pm on 3-15-18 or a WA will be issued on 3-16-18.  jaf
Final notice sent, due 3-15-18. cah

Monica Parent called on behalf of the DE to inquire about which case # the DE is still paying.  Monica was given the case #15CM409 to reference for pymts.  Monica inquired why the DE had to pay on 3 cases & was advised that 1 of the cases was payable to Probation & the other 2 to the Clerk of Court.  She was then advised that each case were separate incidences & the case info is viewable on wicourts.gov. jaf

records.addlTxt: From Monica Parent on behalf of DE requesting to make pymt on 11-10-17.  DE is approved to make his late Nov pymt by 4:30 pm on 11-10-17.  jaf
Final notice sent, due 10/19/17. sf
DE called to state that he forgot about his pymt but will have it pd within the wk.  DE is approved to make his pymt no later than 4:30 pm on 7-14-17.  Includes 14CM649, 15CM409.  jaf
Final notice sent, due 12-15-16. cah

DE's gf, Monica called to inquire if she could make pymt at the end of the month.  She was advised that I already denied her request yesterday & pymt is due by the 15th.  Monica then asked if she could mail a Money Order today & was advised that as long as the pymt is here by 12-15-16, she may mail the pymt.  Includes 14CM649, 15CM409.  jaf

Monica Parent called on behalf of DE requesting an ext stating the DE just pd $465 to get himself off of probation on a different case.  Monica's cell phone was cutting in and out of service & clerk could not hear half of the request nor able to finish the conversation as the phone call was disconnected.  DE's Dec pymt is due by 4:30 pm on 12-15-16 as scheduled or WA to be issued on 12-16-16.  Includes 14CM649, 15CM409.  jaf

**Monica called & left msg again.  Ret'd call to Monica & advised her the pymt is due by 4:30 pm on 12-15-16 or WA to be issued on 12-16-16 as the DE was notified in his last ext notice that he was not to be given another ext unless he had an emergency.  Monica stated the DE is unemployed - clerk attempted to inquire if the DE is actively searching for employment, but Monica became agitated & disconnected the call before further inquiries could be made. jaf

From Monica Parent on behalf of the DE requesting an ext.  Attempted to ret call to Monica but was unable to leave a v/m as her "voicemail has not been set up yet".  Monica ret'd call & was approved for the pymt to be pd by 4:30 pm on 11-11-16.  Includes 14CM649, 15CM409.  jaf

Order for payment on November 7, 2016 at 01:30 pm.

From DE in writing.  DE to pay $20/mo comm 11-05-16 (Oct deferred).  No further extensions & Pplan pymt likely to increase.  DE will be mailed a new Order for Pymt.  Includes 14CM649, 15CM409.  jaf
From DE requesting a deferment of his Oct pymt.  Includes 15CM409, 15CM649. jaf

From Monica Parent requesting a return call.  Ret'd call to Monica - Monica stated the DE is unable to make his Oct pymt as he is unemployed & she had to repair a vehicle.  Monica was advised that the DE will have to submit a request by 10-10-16 & was given all info needed on his request. jaf

CO: Vlack, DAR: Frank, Clerk: Minot, ADA:  Micheal Nieskes. DF ATTY:  Jeremiah James Harrelson   DF:  Erick Lee Lomker appeared. Includes 15CM409, 15CM628 and 15CM661. Case called at 3:39 pm. There is agreement. ADA Nieskes recites. No objection from Atty Harrelson. Count one in 15CM409  amended to be without the Domestic Abuse Enhancer. Court reviews constitutional rights with Def. Court finds Def freely, voluntarily and knowingly waives rights. Court reads charge and possible penalties for ameded count one in 15CM409 and count one in 15CM628 , Def pleads Guilty. Court uses complaints and reports as factual basis, accepts plea and adjudicates Def guilty of amended count one in 15CM409 and count one in 15CM628. Court dismisses all other charges. Parties make sentencing arguments. Court orders

 15CM409
- Court Costs - $243.00
- DNA Surcharge- $200.00
- 60 Days Jail. Credit for 45 Days.

15CM628 
One Year Probation w/h
- 120 Days Jail STAYED
- Court Costs - $243.00
- DNA Surcharge - $200.00. Apply Bond.
- DNA Surcharge; Apply Bond
- Cooperate with any other evaluation, assessment and/or program as requested
- DNA Sample and Surcharge
- Absolute sobriety:  Zero alcohol, zero controlled substances, zero prescribed medications (except as taken and prescribed for you by a physician) in your system, on your person, or in your possession at all times. This prohibition includes drug paraphernalia.
- Not to enter any business or establishment where the primary purpose is sale of alcohol.
- No Abusive Contact with M. Parent
- Sign up for probation by 11/19/2015 at 3:00 pm
- Subject to random UA's and PBT's
- Follow rules and regulations of Agent
- Pay supervision fees

CO: Vlack, DAR: Frank, Clerk: Rohan, ADA: Sharon Correll   DF ATTY: Jeremiah Harrelson   DF:  Erick Lee Lomker appeared from jail. Includes 15CM409 - Status Conference and 14CM649 - Motion Hearing. Case called at 3:32 p.m. Atty. Harrelson requests termination of probation and Court move forward with sentencing in case no. 14CM649. ADA Correll states Court could proceed with sentencing and has no objection to termination of probation. Atty. Harrelson addresses Court. Court questions DEF. In 14CM649, Court makes findings and terminates probation. Court contacts agent. Off the record 3:41 p.m. Court in session 3:47 p.m. Court proceeds with sentencing. ADA Correll makes sentencing recommendations. Atty. Harrelson requests time served 44 days. 
Court Orders in 14CM649:
-60 day jail sentence with credit for 40 days (44 days after confirmation with Jail)
-fines and surcharges $343 to be paid on payment plan
Court confirms address. Bond remains in effect.  Pre-trial conference scheduled for September 10, 2015 at 10:15 am.
Case recalled at 4:34 p.m.
Atty. Harrelson and ADA Nieskes stipulate to 45 days credit for time served. Court approves.

CO: Vlack, DAR: Frank, Clerk: Minot,ADA:   Michael Edward Nieskes   DF ATTY:  Jeremiah James Harrelson   DF:  Erick Lee Lomker appeared from jail. Case called at 4:40 pm. Def is on a PO Hold. Bond continues. km  Status conference scheduled for August 11, 2015 at 10:30 am.
Status conference at 07-22-2015 04:30 pm

- Defendant to report to the St. Croix County Jail every Saturday and Sunday by 10:00 am to take a PBT test. 

- Absolute sobriety:  Zero alcohol, zero controlled substances, zero prescribed medications (except as taken and prescribed for you by a physician) in your system, on your person, or in your possession at all times while this case is ongoing. This prohibition includes drug paraphernalia.

- It is hereby ordered, as a condition of the defendant's bond/bail in the above-captioned case, that he/she have absolutely NO ABUSIVE CONTACT whatsoever with the complaining witness, or with any of the following named persons and/or locations, M. Parent.  The term "abusive contact" is hereby defined as a verbal assault or an intentional infliction of or threat to inflict physical pain, physical injury or illness, an impairment of physical condition, and /or sexual contact or sexual intercourse without consent.  The aforementioned condition of bond/bail is set pursuant to Sec. 969.02(3)(d), Wis Stats.

Further, it is ORDERED that if the defendant fails to comply with the conditions of his/her bond/bail that he/she may be charged with the offense of bailjumping contrary to Sec. 946.49(1)(a), Wis. Stats.

CO: Vlack, DAR: Frank, Clerk: Minot,ADA:   Sharon Correll   DF ATTY:  Alex Andrea   DF:  Erick Lee Lomker appeared from jail. Case called at  1:19 pm. Atty Andrea makes bond arguement. ADA Correll requests bond remains.  Status conference scheduled for July 22, 2015 at 04:30 pm.
Bail/bond hearing at 07-14-2015 01:00 pm

It is hereby ordered, as a condition of the defendant's bond/bail in the above-captioned case, that he/she have absolutely NO CONTACT whatsoever with the complaining witness, or with any of the following named persons and/or locations, Monica P.  The term "no contact" is hereby defined as no contact in person, by telephone, by way of electronic device, email, facsimile, social media including but not limited to texting, Facebook, Twitter, contact through the mail, and/or through a third person.  The aforementioned condition of bond/bail is set pursuant to Sec. 969.02(3)(d), Wis Stats.

Further, it is ORDERED that if the defendant fails to comply with the conditions of his/her bond/bail that he/she may be charged with the offense of bailjumping contrary to Sec. 946.49(1)(a), Wis. Stats.
